meanings.definition: A detailed analysis and assessment of something.
meanings.sent1: She wrote a critique of the book, pointing out its strengths and weaknesses.
meanings.sent2: The professor's critique of the student's essay helped them improve their writing skills.
meanings.sent3: The critique of the movie was so detailed, it felt like a detective solving a mystery.
meanings.sent4: Her critique of the painting was like shining a spotlight on its hidden flaws.
meanings.sent5: The critique provided by the expert was like a roadmap to understanding the complex topic.

meanings.definition: To evaluate or analyze something critically.
meanings.sent1: He critiques every decision before making a choice.
meanings.sent2: She critiques the data to ensure accuracy in the report.
meanings.sent3: Critiquing the recipe, she realized she forgot a key ingredient.
meanings.sent4: Critiquing his own performance, he found areas for improvement.
meanings.sent5: Critiquing the design, she saw room for innovation and creativity.

meanings.definition: A critical review or commentary on a work of art or literature.
meanings.sent1: The magazine published a critique of the new play in town.
meanings.sent2: His critique of the novel highlighted its thematic depth.
meanings.sent3: The critique of the sculpture was so funny, it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her critique of the poem was like unraveling a beautiful mystery.
meanings.sent5: The critique of the artwork was so vivid, it felt like stepping into a different world.
